bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Willard C. Rappleye, January 19, 1953

div1.p: Hench is sending Rappleye information about the Camp Lazear dedication. Hench informs him that de Castro laid three wreaths as Rappleye instructed. He would appreciate reimbursement for the wreaths and can send photographs if Rappleye wishes.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Willard C. Rappleye, January 19, 1953
div1.opener:
January 19, 1953
Dr. Willard C. Rappleye
Dean of the Medical School
College of Physicians and Surgeons
Columbia, University
New York, New York
My dear Doctor Rappleye:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you a copy of a long letter which I have prepared chiefly
for the relatives of those honored at the recent dedication of Camp Lazear.
I thought you might be interested to see it. If you have time to read it
I hope you will find something of interest and perhaps some amusing sidelights
therein.

I certainly appreciate your support in this venture and it was extremely
important to have American participation. My letter will show how the
Cubans responded to this in a most sympathetic fashion. On page 9 of my
letter you will note that Doctor de Castro laid three wreaths as per your
instructions. These wreaths were purchased from “Milagros Flores,” Lucila
Schumann, President, who gave me only one bill itemizing each wreath and
institutional donor. They cost $15. each. If you need an ozalid copy of
the bill I can send it; otherwise I should be glad to receive a check for
$45 at your convenience. Dr. de Castro is a distinguished Cuban physician
and is secretary of the Academy of Sciences. Certainly the College of
Physicians and Surgeons had a dominant role in this ceremony.

Many photographs of the entire affair were taken by news photographers. I
have an incomplete set which includes some of Doctor de Castro placing
certain of these wreaths. Should you want a copy of these or others of the
ceremony, in case you want to have a little note concerning it in your
medical alumni bulletin, I am sure we can get these photographs for you - small
ones for a few cents each or a larger size at what seems to be the usual
price of a dollar or so each.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
